responses:

patterns: how do you treat abrasions?
Do Abrasions cause scars?
Abrasions
what to do if abrasions?
Which medicine to apply for abrasions?
How to cure abrasions?
responses: Begin with washed hands.Gently clean the area with cool to lukewarm water and mild soap. Remove dirt or other particles from the wound using sterilized tweezers.For a mild scrape that’s not bleeding, leave the wound uncovered.If the wound is bleeding, use a clean cloth or bandage, and apply gentle pressure to the area to stop any bleeding.Cover a wound that bled with a thin layer of topical antibiotic ointment, like Bacitracin, or a sterile moisture barrier ointment, like Aquaphor. Cover it with a clean bandage or gauze. Gently clean the wound and change the ointment and bandage once per day.Watch the area for signs of infection, like pain or redness and swelling. See your doctor if you suspect infection.

patterns: How do you treat Sting?
Stings
What to do if you get a sting?
Which medicine to apply if sting?
responses: Remove any stingers immediately. Some experts recommend scraping out the stinger with a credit card. Applying ice to the site may provide some mild relief. Apply ice for 20 minutes once every hour as needed. Wrap the ice in a towel or keep a cloth between the ice and skin to keep from freezing the skin. Taking an antihistamine such as diphenhydramine (Benadryl) or a nonsedating one such as loratadine (Claritin) will help with itching and swelling. Take acetaminophen (Tylenol) or ibuprofen (Motrin)for pain relief as needed. Wash the sting site with soap and water. Placing hydrocortisone cream on the sting can help relieve redness, itching, and swelling.

patterns: How to remove Splinters
How to cure Splinters?
What to do if I have splinters?
Splinter
How do you bring a splinter to the surface?
responses:
1. SOAK IT IN EPSOM SALTS. Dissolve a cup of the salts into a warm bath and soak whatever part of the body has the splinter. Failing that, you can also put some of the salts onto a bandage pad and leave it covered for a day; this will eventually help bring the splinter to the surface. 
2. VINEGAR OR OIL. Another simple way to draw out that stubborn splinter is to soak the affected area in oil (olive or corn) or white vinegar. Just pour some in a bowl and soak the area for around 20 to 30 minutes,

patterns: How do you treat a sprain?
what to do if i get a sprain?
Which cream to apply if i get a sprain?
Sprains
Which medicine to apply if I get a sprain?
responses: Use an ice pack or ice slush bath immediately for 15 to 20 minutes and repeat every two to three hours while you're awake. To help stop swelling, compress the ankle with an elastic bandage until the swelling stops. In most cases, pain relievers — such as ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin IB, others) or naproxen sodium (Aleve, others) or acetaminophen (Tylenol, others) are enough to manage the pain of a sprained ankle.

responses: Rest,Ice,Compression and Elevation can be used to cure strains. Avoid using your muscle for a few days, especially if movement causes an increase in pain and also Apply ice immediately after injuring your muscle. This will minimize swelling. Don’t put ice directly on your skin. Use an ice pack or wrap ice in a towel. To reduce swelling, wrap the affected area with an elastic bandage until swelling comes down.

patterns: How do you treat a mild Fever?
what to do if i get a mild fever?
Which medicine to take if I get a mild fever?
fever
responses:
To treat a fever at home: 
1)Drink plenty of fluids to stay hydrated. 
2)Dress in lightweight clothing. 
3)Use a light blanket if you feel chilled, until the chills end. 
4)Take acetaminophen (Tylenol, others) or ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin IB, others). 
5) Get medical help if the fever lasts more than five days in a row.

Nasal Congestion
How long does nasal congestion last?
responses:
When you’re stuffed up, focus on keeping your nasal passages and sinuses moist. To keep your nasal passages moist, you can: 
 1)Use a humidifier or vaporizer. 
 2)Drink lots of fluids. This will thin out your mucus, which could help prevent blocked sinuses.
 3)Place a warm, wet towel on your face. It may relieve discomfort and open your nasal passages.

patterns: How to cure cough?
How do you treat cough?
what to do if i get a cough?
Which medicine to take if I get cough?
Cough
How do you get rid of cough?
responses:
1) Honey:- Use honey to treat a cough, mix 2 teaspoons (tsp) with warm water or an herbal tea. Drink this mixture once or twice a day. Do not give honey to children under 1 year of age. 
2) Ginger:- Brew up a soothing ginger tea by adding 20–40 grams (g) of fresh ginger slices to a cup of hot water. Allow to steep for a few minutes before drinking. Add honey or lemon juice to improve the taste and further soothe a cough. 
3) Fluids:- Staying hydrated is vital for those with a cough or cold. Research indicates that drinking liquids at room temperature can alleviate a cough, runny nose, and sneezing.

3)Have him sip chicken broth or warm tea with honey. Don’t give honey to a child under 12 months of age.

i got bit by a snake
responses:
While waiting for medical help: 1)Move the person beyond striking distance of the snake.
 2)Have the person lie down with wound below the heart. 
3)Keep the person calm and at rest, remaining as still as possible to keep venom from spreading. 
4)Cover the wound with loose, sterile bandage.
 5)Remove any jewelry from the area that was bitten.
 6)Remove shoes if the leg or foot was bitten.

patterns: What to do if someone is Drowning?
what to do if someone drowned?
What steps to take if i see a drowning person?
How to help a drowning person?
responses:
1)Place your ear next to the person's mouth and nose. Do you feel air on your cheek? 
2)Look to see if the person's chest is moving.If the Person is Not Breathing, Check Pulse. 
3)Check the person's pulse for 10 seconds.If There is No Pulse, Start CPR.

patterns: How to give CPR??
what to do in a CPR?
What steps to take in a CPR??
How to help a drowning person in CPR?
responses:
1)For an adult or child, place the heel of one hand on the center of the chest at the nipple line. You can also push with one hand on top of the other. For an infant, place two fingers on the breastbone.
 2)For an adult or child, press down at least 2 inches. Make sure not to press on ribs. For an infant, press down about 1 and 1/2 inches. Make sure not to press on the end of the breastbone. 
3)Do chest compressions only, at the rate of 100-120 per minute or more. Let the chest rise completely between pushes.
4)Check to see if the person has started breathing.

patterns: How do you treat a Fracture?
what to do if i get a Fracture?
Which medicine to take if I have a Fracture?
How to cure a Fracture?
responses:
1)Stop any bleeding. Apply pressure to the wound with a sterile bandage, a clean cloth or a clean piece of clothing.
 2)Immobilize the injured area. Don't try to realign the bone or push a bone that's sticking out back in. If you've been trained in how to splint and professional help isn't readily available, apply a splint to the area above and below the fracture sites. Padding the splints can help reduce discomfort.
 3)Apply ice packs to limit swelling and help relieve pain. Don't apply ice directly to the skin. Wrap the ice in a towel, piece of cloth or some other material. 
4)Treat for shock. If the person feels faint or is breathing in short, rapid breaths, lay the person down with the head slightly lower than the trunk and, if possible, elevate the legs.

patterns: What are the symptoms of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) infection?
How will i know if i suffering from corona?
syptoms of coronavirus?
responses:
1)Fever.
2)Cough. 
3)Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing. 
4)Tiredness. 
5)Muscle or body aches. 
6)Headaches. 
7)New loss of taste or smell. 
8)Sore throat. 
9)Congestion or runny nose. 
10)Nausea or vomiting. 
11)Diarrhea.

patterns: How is coronavirus diagnosed?

responses: COVID-19 is diagnosed with a laboratory test. Your healthcare provider may collect a sample of your saliva or swab your nose or throat to send for testing.

patterns: If I have a positive test for coronavirus, how long should I self-isolate?
What to do if i have tested positive for corona virus?
How long should I self-isolate?
responses:
You should self-isolate until you've met all three of the following criteria:
 ->It's been 10 days since your symptoms first appeared.
 ->You've not had a fever for 24 hours and you've not used fever-lowing medications during this time.
 ->Your COVID-19 symptoms have improved.

patterns: How can I prevent getting the novel coronavirus (COVID-19)?

responses:

2) Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth, Wear a face mask,
3) Avoid close contact (within six feet) with those who have coughs, colds or are sick.

responses:

patterns: How is corneal disease diagnosed?
Corneal Disease
Eye Disease
Can corneal disease be prevented?
responses:
Corneal disease can only be diagnosed after a thorough examination by an ophthalmologist.
Avoid sharing eye makeup, contact solution, lens cases and eye drops with people who are infected.
Wash your hands thoroughly with soap and warm water for at least 15 seconds after contact with an infected person.

patterns: How is ptosis (drooping eyelid) treated?
Drooping Eyelid
responses:
Treatment usually depends on how well the eyelid muscles are functioning. 
If the ptosis does not affect vision and the patient does not mind the appearance, doctor might recommend no treatment at all.

patterns: How is skin fungus treated?
Can I treat a fungal rash at home?
what type of cream are used to cure skin fungus?
responses:
Treatment for skin fungus includes:
Antifungal creams, Stronger prescription medications,Oral medicines, if the fungal infection is severe.

patterns: What is the treatment for freckles?
Freckles

what to do to reduce skin freckles?
responses: There's no treatment. It’s best to avoid the sun as much as possible, or use a sunscreen.

patterns: skin tags

responses: Your dermatologist can remove a skin tag by cutting it off with a scalpel or scissors, with cryotherapy (freezing it off), or with electrosurgery (burning with an electric current)

patterns: lentigines
How are lentigines treated?

responses:

Cryotherapy (freezing it off)
Laser surgery
Creams that are applied to the skin (these include retinoids and bleaching agents)

patterns: Delirium
How to cure Delirium?
How is delirium treated?
responses:
Treatment for delirium depends on the cause. Treatments may include:
Antibiotics for infections.
Fluids and electrolytes for dehydration.
Benzodiazepines for problems due to drug and alcohol withdrawal.

patterns: Schizophrenia
Can schizophrenia be treated?
How schizophrenia is treated?
responses:
The main types of treatment are counseling and medicines to lessen or stop psychotic symptoms. 
Medicines will control psychotic symptoms in most people. 
In milder cases of schizophrenia, medications may not be needed.

patterns: How is bipolar disorder diagnosed?
Bipolar Disorder
What to do if I have Bipolar Disorder
responses:
A diagnosis of bipolar disorder is made only by taking careful note of symptoms, and their severity, length, and frequency.
A thorough medical evaluation should be performed.

patterns: Depression
How is depression syndrome treated?
How to cure mental health problem (depression)?
What to do if I am suffering from depression?
responses:
1) Regular exercise, getting enough sleep, and spending time with people you care about can improve depression symptoms.
 2)Counseling or psychotherapy is talking with a mental health professional.
3)Prescription medicine called antidepressants can help change brain chemistry that causes depression.

patterns: How are depression and anxiety in children treated?
Depression in Children
How to cure depression in children?
Can I prevent my child from developing depression or anxiety?
responses:
1.Psychotherapy (counseling) & Medication. 
 Daily exercise.
 2.Safe, supportive environment at home and school.
 3. Plenty of sleep. 
4. Well-balanced meals.

patterns: How is factitious disorder treated?
Factitious Disorders
How to cure Factitious Disorders?
responses:
The primary treatment for factitious disorder is psychotherapy (a type of counseling). 
Treatment likely will focus on changing the thinking and behavior of the individual with the disorder (cognitive-behavioral therapy).
Family therapy also may help in teaching family members not to reward or reinforce the behavior of the person with the disorder.

patterns: Body Dysmorphic Disorder
What are treatments for body dysmorphic disorder (BDD)?
How to cure Body Dysmorphic Disorder?
responses: Psychotherapy and Medication

patterns: Intermittent Explosive Disorder

Treatment for Intermittent Explosive Disorder
responses: Intermittent explosive disorder may best be treated by a combination of cognitive behavioral therapy and medications

patterns: How are changes in urine treated?
Urine Changes
Treatments for urine color changes?
responses:
Changes caused by underlying conditions such as urinary tract infections or kidney stones.
Changes in urine are not specifically treated. 
Your doctor will treat the underlying cause once it is determined

patterns: Pemphigus
Cure for Pemphigus
What are the treatments for pemphigus?
responses:
Doctors use medications to treat pemphigus. 
Medications that reduce inflammation (swelling), delivered by mouth, by injection (a shot) or topically (such as lotions or creams)

patterns: How is lichen sclerosus treated?
Lichen Sclerosus
How to cure lichen sclerosus?
Tretment for lichen sclerosus
responses:

patterns: How are genital warts managed or treated?
Genital Warts
What to do if I have warts in my genital area?
How to cure warts?
responses:
Once a week for several weeks, you apply a prescription chemical solution to the warts. 
The chemical causes blisters to form under the warts, stopping blood flow.
 In some cases, your provider may apply the solution.

patterns: What  can I do to relieve the pain of vulvodynia?
Vulvodynia

responses:
Avoid tight clothing and pantyhose.
Wear all-cotton underwear.
Use cold compresses or gel packs.
Avoid exercises that put pressure on the vulva, like cycling or horseback riding.
Wash the area gently with plain water.

patterns: How is vaginitis treated?
Treatment for Vaginitis
responses:
The key to proper treatment of vaginitis is proper diagnosis.
The important thing to understand is that medication may only cure the most common types of candida associated with vaginal yeast infections and will not cure other yeast infections or any other type of vaginitis.

patterns: What are the risks of cardiac tumors?
cardiac tumors
Risk of tumors
responses:
Tumors that block blood flow can cause heart failure, stroke, atrial fibrillation and blood clots.Risk is embolism. 
This means that part of the tumor or a blood clot can travel to other parts of the circulatory system.

patterns: What foods should I avoid if I have had gallstones?

how to cure gallstone?

Adding fresh vegetables and fruit.

responses:

responses: Strep throat (tonsillitis caused by bacteria) is treated with an antibiotic medication. Antibiotics require a prescription from your doctor.

responses:

Drink warm liquids, like tea, apple cider or broth.
Gargle with warm salt water.
Try throat lozenges.

patterns: How are urinary tract infections (UTI) treated?

Urinary Infecttion
responses:

patterns: Can I prevent a urinary tract infection (UTI)?

responses:
Practicing good hygiene, Drinking plenty of fluids
 Changing your urination habits

patterns: How is insomnia managed or treated?
How can I prevent insomnia?
Prevention of lolss of sleep
how to treat loss of sleep at night?
responses:
Avoid large meals, caffeine and alcohol before bed.
Be physically active during the day, outside if possible.
Cut back on caffeine, including coffee, sodas and chocolate, throughout the day and especially at night.
Go to bed and get up at the same time each day, including weekends.
Put away smartphones, TVs, laptops or other screens at least 30 minutes before bedtime.
Quit smoking.

patterns: What are the symptoms of insomnia?
what body changes we feel if we suffer from insomnia?
What are the symptoms loss of sleep at night?
responses:
Difficulty falling asleep and waking up in the middle of the night.
Difficulty returning to sleep.
Feeling tired/fatigued during the daytime.
Irritability or depressed mood.
Problems with concentration or memory.

patterns: How are sleep disorders treated?
How to cure sleep disorders?
responses:
Counseling, Medications,Practice sleep hygiene such as keeping a regular sleep schedule.
Get regular exercise.
Minimize noise.
Minimize light.

patterns: What are the benefits of exercise?
What can we get by doing exercise?
Advantages of doing regular exercise?
responses:
Maintain blood pressure
Improvement in the heart's pumping ability
More energetic feeling, less fatigue
Easing the pain or stiffness of arthritic joints
A more positive attitude, less strain and tension
Better sleeping patterns
Improved appetite

patterns: What is the right kind of exercise?
Right Exercise
What are the right type of exercise?
What is right exercise?
responses:
A good exercise plan starts slowly, allowing your body time to adjust.
The right kind of exercise never makes you feel sore, stiff, or exhausted.
Walking, stationary bike, yoga, or swimming

patterns: What is the wrong kind of exercise?
Wrong Exercise
What are the wrong type of exercise?
What is wrong exercise?
responses:
Even more dangerous than doing no exercise is exercising only occasionally and doing too much, too fast.
 If you experience soreness, stiffness, exhaustion, or feel out of breath as a result of your exercise, you are overdoing it.

stress

low testosterone

patterns: What are the benefits of testosterone replacement therapy?
testosterone replacement therapy
what are the advantages of testosterone replacement therapy?
responses:
Loss of fat 
Increased bone density and protection against osteoporosis 
Improved mood and sense of well-being 
Improved sexual function 
Improved mental sharpness
Greater muscle strength and physical performance

patterns: Who shouldn't take testosterone replacement therapy?
who shouldn't get testosterone replacement therapy?
responses: men who have prostate cancer,an enlarged prostate, breast cancershould not take testosterone replacement therapy.

patterns: How is mental illness of childhood  treated?

responses:

 Treatment usually includes therapy and education for both patient and family.

patterns: What complications are associated with childhood schizophrenia?
Complications in mental illness for children
responses: Childhood schizophrenia may cause difficulties throughout a child’s life, and can affect learning, memory, relationships and productivity.

patterns: How to reduce sleep walking?
Sleep Walking
How to cure sleep walking
responses:
At bedtime listen to soft music.
 Establish regular nap and sleep schedules.
 Avoid caffeine near bedtime

patterns: What should I expect if I have narcolepsy?
Treatment for narcolepsy
How to cure narcolepsy
responses: There is no cure for narcolepsy. It is a life-long sleeping disorder. However, it usually does not worsen with age. The use of medications and lifestyle changes can help improve narcolepsy symptoms

patterns: Narcolepsy in Children
What are the suggestions to prevent or treat narcolepsy
responses:
Follow a regular sleep/wake schedule.
 Go to bed and wake up at about the same time every day.  
Take short naps (20 to 30 minutes) at times when you are feeling most sleepy, if possible. 
Keep your bedroom quiet, dark, cool, and comfortable. Do not watch TV or bring computers or phones into bed with you. 
Avoid caffeine for several hours before bedtime. 
Exercise at least 20 minutes per day. Do not exercise within 3 hours of bedtime.

patterns: Hemophilia
what to do if we suffer fromHemophilia

responses:
At the time of a joint bleed, you can treat the pain using the “RICE” (Rest, Ice, Compression, Elevation) protocol.
 If you are suffering from pain related to an injury, you can use acetaminophen

patterns: What are the recommendation to maintain good health/ healthy lfestyle?
suggestion for healthy lisestyle

how to achieve good health?
good helth
healthy lifestyle

responses:

patterns: What are the suggestions to treat frequent urination at night?
Frequet urination
Solution for frequent urination
responses:
Restrict fluids in the evening. 
Elevate the legs (this helps prevent fluid accumulation). 
Wear compression stockings (this also helps prevent fluid accumulation). 
Regulate medications that reduce symptoms of overactive bladder.

patterns: How to treat infertility in women?
Infertility in Women
Treatments for infertility in women
responses:
Fertility drugsand hormones to help the woman ovulate or restore levels of hormones. 
Surgery to remove tissue that is blocking fertility (such as endometriosis) or to open blocked fallopian tubes.

patterns: How to treat infertility in men?
Infertility in men
Treatments for infertility in men
responses:
IVF (in vitro fertilization): The sperm and egg are collected and brought together in a lab. The fertilized egg grows for 3 to 5 days days. Then the embryo is placed in the woman's uterus.
 GIFT (gamete intrafallopian transfer) and ZIFT (zygote intrafallopian transfer): The sperm and egg are collected and quickly placed in a fallopian tube. With GIFT, the both sperm and eggs are placed into the fallopian tube. With ZIFT, the sperm and eggs are brought together in a lab and then a fertilized egg is placed into the tube at 24 hours.

patterns: What are the symptoms of early pregnancy?
Symptoms of pregnancy
How can I  know if I am pregnant?
responses:
Missed menstrual cycle 
Mood changes
 Increased urination
 Headaches, Low backache and/or pain
 Sore breasts
 Darkened areolas
 Tiredness
 Nausea

patterns: What are the symptoms of post pregnancy depression?
Post preganncy depression
responses:
Depressed mood or severe mood swings,Excessive crying
Difficulty bonding with your baby, 
Withdrawing from family and friends,Loss of appetite or eating much more than usual 
Inability to sleep (insomnia) or sleeping too much,Overwhelming fatigue or loss of energy, 
Reduced interest and pleasure in activities you used to enjoy,Fear that you're not a good mother, 
Hopelessness,Feelings of worthlessness, shame, guilt or inadequacy

responses: To prevent bloating:Reglar Massages, Regular Medications,lifestyle changes(eating habit) helps to relievw bloating

patterns: What are the treatment for common cold in babies?
How to cure Common cold in babies
Common cold in babies
responses:
Give plenty of liquids, including breast milk or formula.
 A small amount of water may be offered to your baby if they’re over 6 months old. 
Suction out nasal mucus using saline drops and a suction bulb.
Moisturize the air with a humidifier.

patterns: How can I treat pneumonia?
How to cure pneumonia
Treatment for pneumonia
responses:
Control your fever with aspirin, nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs, such as ibuprofen or naproxen), or acetaminophen.
 Donot give aspirin to children. 
Drink plenty of fluids to help loosen secretions and bring up phlegm. 
Do not take cough medicines without first talking to your doctor. If your cough is preventing you from getting the rest you need, ask your doctor about steps you can take to get relief. 
Drink warm beverages, take steamy baths and use a humidifier to help open your airways and ease your breathing.

patterns: What are the methods of treating burning eyes?
How can I treat burning eyes?
How to prevent eyes from burning?
responses:
Cleaning the eyelid margins near the base of the eyelashes, using a gentle cleanser and lukewarm water. 
Applying lubricating eye drops to reduce redness and improve eye comfort. 
Applying a warm compress to the eyes. Make a compress by soaking a clean, soft towel in warm water and then placing it over the eyes. 
Using antihistamine eye drops or tablets to reduce the effects of allergic reactions in the eyes. 
Drinking plenty of water throughout the day. 
Taking regular breaks from using a computer screen .

patterns: How can I treat altitude sickness?
What are the preventions for altitude sickness?
Altitude sickness
How to cure altitude sickness?
responses: Avoid flying directly to areas of high altitude, if possible take 2 to 3 days to get used to high altitudes before going above 2,500m,avoid climbing more than 300m to 500m a day,have a rest day every 600m to 900m you go up, or rest every 3 to 4 days

patterns: What are the symptoms of itchy eyes?
how can I know if I am sffering from eye itchiness?
responses:
Red, irritated eyes, 
Tearing or runny eyes, 
Swollen eyelids, 
Soreness, burning, or pain, 
Sensitivity to light.

patterns: What are the treatment for itchy eyes?
How to cure itchy eyes?
Itchy eyes
How can I prevent of itching my eye?
responses:
Wear sunglasses when you go outside. They'll block some of the pollen and other outdoor allergens from getting into your eyes. 
Rinse your eyes with preservative-free saline water or apply a cold, wet washcloth. 
Use lubricating eye drops (artificial tears) to moisten dry eyes and wash out allergens. 
Take out your contact lenses. 
Don’t rub your eyes, no matter how much they itch.

responses: Be careful about what you drink. Watch what you eat. Practice good hygiene.

patterns: What are the symptoms of diabetes?
what changes in body do we feel if we suffer from diabetes?
responses:
Urinate (pee) a lot, often at night. 
Are very thirsty. 
Lose weight without trying. 
Are very hungry. 
Have blurry vision. 
Have numb or tingling hands or feet. 
Feel very tired. 
Have very dry skin. 
Have sores that heal slowly. 
Have more infections than usual.

patterns: How can I control diabetes?
Treatments for diabetes

responses:
Get more physical activity. 
Get plenty of fiber. Go for whole grains. 
Skip fat diets and just make healthier choices.

patterns: What are the symptoms of AIDS

responses:
Rapid weight loss. 
Recurring fever or profuse night sweats. 
Extreme and unexplained tiredness. 
Prolonged swelling of the lymph glands in the armpits, groin, or neck. 
Diarrhea that lasts for more than a week. 
Sores of the mouth, anus, or genitals. 
Pneumonia. 
Memory loss, depression.

patterns: How can we prevent from Hepatitis B?

responses:
Do not inject drugs.

USe protection while having sex.

patterns: What are the symptoms of chickenpox ini adults?
responses:
Flu-like symptoms such as fever, fatigue, loss of appetite, body aches, and headache. 
Red spots appear on the face and chest, eventually spreading over the entire body. The red spots develop into itchy, fluid-filled blisters. 
Blisters weep, become sores, form crusts, and heal.

patterns: What are the symptoms of chickenpox in children?
responses:
Breathing problems.
Weakness such as a child becoming wobbly on his/her feet.
Drowsiness.
Fits (convulsions).
Pains or headaches which become worse despite paracetamol.
Being unable to take fluids, due to a severe rash in the mouth.
A severe rash, or a rash which bruises or bleeds into the skin (haemorrhagic rash).

patterns: What are the treatment of chickenpox?
How to cure chickenpox?
How chicken pox is treated?
responses:
You can give paracetamol 
Take extra layers of clothes off your child if the room is normal room temperature.
Give lots to drink.
A sedating antihistamine (in a tablet or liquid medicine) may help with sleep if itch is a problem.

patterns: What are cholera symptoms and signs?
responses:
Watery diarrhea (sometimes in large volumes)
Rice-water stools
Fishy odor to stools 
Vomiting 
Rapid heart rate. 
Loss of skin elasticity 
Dry mucous membranes (dry mouth) 
Low blood pressure.

patterns: How can we prevent cholera
Remedies to prevent cholera?
Preventive measures to follow in case of cholera
responses:
Make sure to drink and use safe water to brush your teeth, wash and prepare food, and make ice. ...
Wash your hands often with soap and safe water* ...
Use latrines or bury your poop; do not poop in any body of water. ...
Cook food well (especially seafood), keep it covered, and eat it hot.

patterns: What are the symptoms of  dysentery?
responses: Diarrhea with belly cramps, Fever, Nausea and vomiting, Blood or mucus in the diarrhea.

patterns: How can we prevent from dysentery?

responses:
washing your hands with soap and warm water after using the toilet and regularly throughout the day. 
washing your hands before handling, eating or cooking food. 
avoiding sharing towels. 
washing the laundry of an infected person on the hottest setting possible.

patterns: Whatare the symptoms of inahaltion anthrax?

patterns: What are the symptoms of aspergillosis?

patterns: How can we prevent from aspergillosis?

responses:
Avoid exposure.
